sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"writing-with-flair"}}>{`Writing With Flair`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"purpose-of-writing"}}>{`Purpose Of Writing`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Conveying information.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`To entertain.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`To persuade.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`To inspire.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"the-mindset-of-elite-writing"}}>{`The Mindset Of Elite Writing`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Really think if this is the right word, necessary word etc. - this is the attention to detail that you need.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`No needless words - you want to communicate, not impress.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Presentation of work should be slick and consistent.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"the-secret-sauce-of-flair"}}>{`The Secret Sauce Of Flair`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Simplicity `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Clarity `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Elegance`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"1-simplicity"}}>{`1. Simplicity`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"11-economy"}}>{`1.1 Economy`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Use shorter words unless there is a need for precision. Shorter words help quicken comprehension. When to break that rule? Avoiding repetition, adding rhythm and where the is a real distinction between the choice of two words.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`A good journalist will use the fewest words possible to convey a thought.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`A useful maxim: `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p"><MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="strong">{`Any word that can go, must go.`}</MDXTag></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"12-repetition"}}>{`1.2 Repetition`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Within a piece of work, the same point is made. Reduction is required.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"13-overcomplicating-things"}}>{`1.3 Overcomplicating Things`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Making simple points sound more complex than they are. Simplify as much as possible.`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
